Welcome to Collegeville Borough

The Borough of Collegeville is a great place to live, work, and play. We are a close-knit community, and take great pride in our neighborhoods, streets, and parks. Come be a part of the community.

Welcome to Collegeville Borough

The Borough of Collegeville is a great place to live, work, and play. We are a close-knit community, and take great pride in our neighborhoods, streets, and parks. Come be a part of the community.

Welcome to Collegeville Borough

Welcome to Collegeville Borough

The Borough of Collegeville is a great place to live, work, and play. We are a close-knit community, and take great pride in our neighborhoods, streets, and parks. Come be a part of the community.

Bulletin Board

LED Streetlight Study

Collegeville Borough is studying the feasibility of converting the boro's existing streetlights to LED lights. The Borough is part of a region-wide group of municipalities that are looking at the possible economic advantages of replacing the existing streetlights with LED lights.  The study below, conducted by Keystone Lighting Solutions, is a Phase 1 preliminary study of the Borough's current energy and maintenance costs of streetlight system.   Phase1 Collegeville Borough 

Boards & Commissions

Borough Council is seeking residents who have an interest in serving on one the many Collegeville boards and commissions.  Listed below are the Collegeville Borough bodies that require volunteers and occasionally have openings when terms expire.  The only requirement is that you are a Collegeville Borough resident and a registered to vote. 

BOCA Board of Appeals
Civil Service Commission
Collegeville-Trappe Municipal Authority
Collegeville-Trappe Public Works Committee
Lower Perkiomen Valley Regional Sewer Authority
Planning Commission
Vacancy Board
Zoning Hearing Board

For a description of each body please visit the click here.  Interested residents should email their resume or letter of interest to Borough Manager, Geoff Thompson at gthompson@borough.collegeville-pa.gov

Daily Bread Food Pantry

We accept donations at Borough Hall ALL year!
They currently are requesting the following items:
Personal Care (toothpaste, paper towels, laundry soap, etc)
Canned meats
Canned veggies
Soup
Beans
Dry cat food
Thank you for your generosity!

Mayor's Open Office Hours

Mayor Aidsand Wright-Riggins holds regular Open-Door Office Hours at 476 E. Main Street on Tuesday mornings and Thursday evenings. He welcomes conversations with residents, business owners and others during these office hours. You may arrange to meet with him on Tuesdays, Thursdays and at other times by calling him 24 hours in advance at (888) 804 2945 or by sending an email to MayorAWR@council.collegeville-pa.gov.  Mayor Wright-Riggins, also an ordained minister, welcomes the opportunity to officiate at weddings and funerals without cost to Collegeville residents (In lieu of an honorarium, donations to the Daily Bread Food Pantry are requested). Mayor Wright-Riggins does not discriminate on the basis of gender or sexual orientation regarding the performance of wedding ceremonies.

Automated Collegeville-Trappe Utility Bill Paying

Collegeville-Trappe water and sewer customers wishing to sign up for the Automated Bill Payment Program (ACH) can obtain the enrollment form here: C-T ACH

Newsletter Signup

     Sign up for for our newsletter by clicking here

View the most recent version of our newsletter here

Follow Us

  • Facebook


Storm Water Issues: To report Storm Water Issues, please send an email to: info@borough.collegeville-pa.gov
